newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran energy minister designate outlines plans.
newsitem.headline: Iran energy minister designate outlines plans.

text.p: Iran's energy minister designate intends to implement plans for large-scale power and water projects if parliament confirms his appointment, the official news agency IRNA said on Saturday.
Habibollah Bitaraf, nominated by President Mohammad Khatami on Tuesday, told IRNA he planned to use his term to build 70 reservoir dams and boost water supply capacity in urban areas.
He said he would also improve piped water networks in urban areas to meet the needs of one million new subscribers and planned to raise hydroelectric power generating capacity.
"He said that his ministry would increase its sewerage networks to 35,000 km (22,000 miles) and would admit 700,000 new subscribers in this sector," IRNA reported.
Bitaraf also planned to provide electricity to each village with more than 20 families, the agency said.
Iran has a population of over 60 million.
Khatami, who has a reputation for political openness, was elected president on a mandate of introducing social and economic reforms.
The 270-seat Majlis, or parliament, is expected to vote on his 22 nominated ministers next week.
